title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 2 Live Updates: Issue subscribed over 17 times so far; Check GMP, review, other key details | Stock Market News - Mint

The initial public offering (IPO) of Indo Farm Equipment Ltd has received an overwhelming response from investors on its first day, being oversubscribed more than 17 times as it enters the second day of bidding. The issue is set to close on January 2, with a price band of ₹204 to ₹215 per share.

title: Multibagger stock IREDA share price jumps 6% post business updates; loan book sees 36% growth | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
IREDA Share Price Surges 6% Following Strong Business Updates

Date: January 1, 2024   Source: Live Mint

The Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA) saw its share price jump nearly 6% following the release of provisional business updates indicating strong loan book growth.

Business Updates

  • Loan book growth of 36% till December 2024 compared to the previous year.
  • Loans sanctioned worth ₹31,087 crore, representing a 129% increase over ₹13,558 crore in the same period of 2023.
  • Loan disbursements at ₹17,236 crore, a 41% rise compared to ₹12,220 crore the previous year.
  • The outstanding loan book reached ₹69,000 crore, up from ₹50,580 crore in December 2023.

Stock Price Impact

IREDA's share price rose 5.83% to ₹227.70, reflecting positive market response despite having corrected from all-time highs.

Notable Quotes

“Though IREDA share price has corrected significantly from its all-time highs, it still rose 105% in 2024, delivering multibagger returns to its investors.”

The article highlights IREDA's role as a significant financial body in renewable energy and energy efficiency, established in 1987.

Conclusion

IREDA's robust performance and share price increase exemplify its growth in a challenging market, providing valuable returns to investors.
newTitle: IREDA Share Price Surges 6% Following Strong Business Updates

title: ITC Hotels Listing: Will the demerged entity become a part of MSCI, FTSE indices? - CNBCTV18
summary:
ITC Hotels Listing: Will the Demerged Entity Join MSCI and FTSE Indices?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: CNBC TV18

ITC Hotels Ltd., the new hotels business formed by the demerger from ITC Ltd., is preparing for its stock market debut, with analysts predicting its potential inclusion in various market indices.

  • The MSCI plans to temporarily add ITC Hotels as a detached security to their Global Standard Indexes as of January 6.
  • ITC Hotels may qualify for the MSCI Global Smallcap Indexes based on current estimates.
  • The FTSE has yet to announce its stance on the incorporation of ITC Hotels into its indices.
  • ITC Hotels is expected to have a market entry price between ₹150 - ₹175 per share.
Nuvama Alternative expects the share price adjustment post-demerger to be between ₹22 - ₹25 per share.

This listing and potential index inclusion could have significant implications for the valuation and market strategy of ITC Hotels.
newTitle: ITC Hotels Listing: Will the Demerged Entity Join MSCI and FTSE Indices?

9 Most Influential Crypto Cities in the World in 2024 - Decrypt
summary:
9 Most Influential Crypto Cities in the World in 2024

Publication Date: 2024

Source: Decrypt

Cryptocurrencies have established a stronger foothold in global financial ecosystems, and cities worldwide are vying to be hubs for blockchain innovation and adoption. This year, the industry has progressed, from regulatory clarity to a thriving startup culture. Here are nine cities shaping the crypto landscape in 2024.

  • Berlin, Germany: Germany clarified tax rules for crypto, enhancing its status as Europe’s premier crypto hub.
  • Singapore: Expanded regulatory sandbox provides opportunities for fintech startups in tokenized assets and DeFi.
  • Dubai, UAE: Issued comprehensive crypto guidelines, attracting global exchanges.
  • Tokyo, Japan: Implemented tax reforms to incentivize institutional investment in crypto.
  • Sydney, Australia: Hosted Aus Crypto Con, showcasing local innovations despite slow regulatory development.
  • San Francisco, US: Silicon Valley continues to foster disruptive crypto projects with renewed venture funding.
  • Miami, US: Remains dynamic with events enhancing its crypto hub status.
  • New York City, US: Strengthened blockchain hub with tighter regulations, attracting firms like Circle.
  • Hong Kong: Proposed tax exemptions for crypto gains to enhance its wealth management appeal.
“Berlin is solidifying its place as Europe’s premier crypto hub for 2025,” said Hannes Graah of Zeal.
newTitle: 9 Most Influential Crypto Cities in the World in 2024

As New Year's Eve celebrations kicked off, Swiggy's CEO provided insights into order trends and the preparations of the company's teams to handle the surge in demand for food delivery.

  • Bengaluru topped the charts for food orders, particularly for biryani.
  • A poll was conducted to predict the most ordered item among pizza, burger, and biryani.

Source: PTI

Co-founder and promoter Nishant Pitti sold a 1.4% stake in Easy Trip Planners for ₹78 crore, leading to a decline in the company's share price.

  • Nishant Pitti sold 4.99 crore shares at an average price of ₹15.68.
  • Pitti's stake in the company decreased from 14.21% to 12.8%.
  • The total promoter stake dropped to 48.97%.
  • Shares closed 6.92% lower at ₹15.87 after trading.
  • Pitti previously sold a 14% stake for ₹920 crore in September 2023.
“The sharp decline in Easy Trip Planner shares came amid reports that the company’s promoter and co-founder Nishant Pitti will sell off his remaining 14.21% stake.”

title: TCS Fixes Third Interim Dividend Record Date—Check Details Here - NDTV Profit
summary:
TCS Fixes Third Interim Dividend Record Date—Check Details Here

Date: 31 Dec 2024 | Source: NDTV Profit

Tata Consultancy Services Ltd. has announced January 17, 2025, as the record date for shareholders eligible for the third interim dividend. The board meeting will also confirm the Q3 FY2025 financial results.

  • The TCS board will meet on January 9, 2025, to approve financial results.
  • Shareholders on record as of January 17, 2025, will be eligible for the dividend.
  • TCS previously announced interim dividends of Rs 10 per share in July and October.
  • TCS's market cap stands at Rs 14.81 lakh crore after significant losses reported recently.
  • The company is engaged in a partnership with Bank of Baroda for expanding financial inclusion solutions.
The company announced a second interim dividend of Rs 10 per equity share of Rs 1 each of the company.

In conclusion, TCS is moving forward with its updates and partnerships while keeping eligible shareholders informed of the upcoming dividend procedures.

title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Wednesday - The Economic Times
Top gainers of 2024 | Trent, M&M among top 10 Nifty 50 performers, deliver hefty 25-135% returns in last 12 months | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Top Gainers of 2024: Nifty 50 Performers Deliver 25-135% Returns

Date & Source: December 31, 2024 | Live Mint

The Indian stock market saw significant fluctuations in 2024, hitting record highs before facing corrections due to sluggish corporate earnings and foreign fund exits, resulting in an annual gain of about 8.5% while still marking the ninth consecutive year of positive returns for major equity benchmarks.

Investors experienced a wealth increase of ₹77.66 lakh crore amidst challenges, as Nifty 50 stocks outperformed others, with top gainers showing returns between 25-135% over 12 months.

  • Trent emerged as the top performer with a 133.17% return.
  • Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) came second with a 73.88% return.
  • Bharat Electronics Ltd (BEL) saw a 59.15% return.
  • Overall, blue-chip stocks remained in correction territory after various market dynamics.
  • Broader market rally was led by small and mid-cap stocks gaining about 24% each.
“Losses were mainly in IT and realty stocks, while other sectors saw gains...” - Vinod Nair, Head of Research at Geojit Financial Services

The outlook for 2025 appears optimistic, with expectations of strong economic growth and advancements across various sectors as India gears up for continued success.
newTitle: Top Gainers of 2024: Nifty 50 Performers Deliver 25-135% Returns

BSE, NSE Holidays 2025: Is Stock Market Open On 1st January? - News18
summary:
BSE, NSE Holidays 2025: Is Stock Market Open On 1st January?

Last Updated: January 01, 2025, 00:36 IST

As the new year begins, investors are curious if Indian stock markets will operate on January 1, 2025. The Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) have confirmed that trading will proceed as usual on this day, including various market segments.

Key Points:

  • The stock markets will remain open for trading on January 1, 2025.
  • Only one stock market holiday in January, which is on January 26 (Republic Day).
  • The BSE and NSE provided a holiday schedule detailing 14 non-trading days throughout 2025.
  • Holidays include significant dates like Maha Shivaratri, Holi, Good Friday, and Diwali.

“The holiday schedule ensures that traders and investors have ample time to prepare their trading strategies around non-working days.”

This information is crucial for traders and investors in planing their activities around holiday schedules for better preparation.
newTitle: BSE and NSE Trading Holidays for 2025: No Market Closure on January 1

title: Small savings schemes: Interest rates on PPF, SSY, SCSS remain unchanged for January-March quarter; Check rates | Mint - Mint
summary:
Small savings schemes: Interest rates on PPF, SSY, SCSS remain unchanged for January-March quarter; Check rates

Date: December 31, 2024

Source: Live Mint

The central government has announced that the interest rates for various small savings schemes will remain unchanged for the January to March quarter of FY 2024-25, marking the fourth consecutive quarter with no adjustments.

  • The interest rates for Public Provident Fund (PPF) and National Savings Certificate (NSC) are kept at 7.1 per cent and 7.7 per cent, respectively.
  • Kisan Vikas Patra (KVP) interest rate is set at 7.5 per cent.
  • The Senior Citizen Savings Scheme (SCSS) will continue at 8.2 per cent.
  • The Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY) maintains an interest rate of 8.2 per cent.
  • Post Office Monthly Income Scheme (PO-MIS) offers an interest rate of 7.4 per cent.
  • Deposits made in the five-year recurring deposit (RD) scheme will earn 6.7 per cent.
The government notifies the interest rates on small savings schemes every quarter, based on recommendations from the Shyamala Gopinath Committee.

This stability in interest rates comes as a strategy to promote consistent savings behavior across various demographics, especially among senior citizens and parents saving for their daughters' future.
newTitle: Small Saving Schemes Maintain Interest Rates for January-March Quarter

title: Interest rates on small savings schemes remain unchanged - The Hindu
summary:
Interest Rates on Small Savings Schemes Remain Unchanged

Date: December 31, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The Centre has decided to keep the interest rates for small savings schemes unchanged for the January to March 2025 quarter, marking the fourth consecutive quarter without change.

  • The interest rates for schemes like PPF and NSC are recalibrated quarterly based on government securities yields.
  • The government had previously increased rates on small savings schemes by 70-250 basis points since Q3 of 2022-23.
  • The Sukanya Samriddhi Account Scheme rate is now at 8.2%, while PPF remains at 7.1% since April 2020.
The government increased rates cumulatively between 70-250 basis points over the last year.

This status quo in interest rates reflects stabilizing financial conditions, with certain schemes maintaining their appeal for savers.
newTitle: Interest Rates on Small Savings Schemes Remain Unchanged
